ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Indicate types of gambling activity in the past year that may have been problematic. Check all that apply
Notes: 0= card playing; 1= lottery; 2= horse racing; 3= sports betting; 4= casino games; 5= slot machines; 6= day trading; 7= Other

ElementDescription: Types of gambling. Other, Specify
Needs to gamble with increasing amounts of money in order to achieve the desired excitement.
Notes: 0= Not Assessed; 1= Absent or false; 2= Subthreshold; 3= Threshold; 999= Inadequate information

ElementDescription: Has made repeated unsuccessful efforts to control, cut back, or stop gambling.
Notes: 0= Not Assessed; 1= Absent or false; 2= Subthreshold; 3= Threshold; 999= Inadequate information

ElementDescription: Is restless or irritable when attempting to cut down or stop gambling.
Notes: 0= Not Assessed; 1= Absent or false; 2= Subthreshold; 3= Threshold; 999= Inadequate information

ElementDescription: Is often preoccupied with gambling (e.g., having persistent thoughts of reliving past gambling experiences, handicapping or planning the next venture, thinking of ways to get money with which to gamble).
Notes: 0= Not Assessed; 1= Absent or false; 2= Subthreshold; 3= Threshold; 999= Inadequate information

ElementDescription: Often gambles when feeling distressed (e.g., helpless, guilt, anxious, depressed).
Notes: 0= Not Assessed; 1= Absent or false; 2= Subthreshold; 3= Threshold; 999= Inadequate information

ElementDescription: After losing money gambling, often returns another day to get even (chasing ones losses).
Notes: 0= Not Assessed; 1= Absent or false; 2= Subthreshold; 3= Threshold; 999= Inadequate information

ElementDescription: Lies to conceal the extent of involvement with gambling.
Notes: 0= Not Assessed; 1= Absent or false; 2= Subthreshold; 3= Threshold; 999= Inadequate information

ElementDescription: Has jeopardized or lost a significant relationship, job, or educational or career opportunity because of gambling.
Notes: 0= Not Assessed; 1= Absent or false; 2= Subthreshold; 3= Threshold; 999= Inadequate information

ElementDescription: Relies on others to provide money to relieve desperate financial situations caused by gambling.
Notes: 0= Not Assessed; 1= Absent or false; 2= Subthreshold; 3= Threshold; 999= Inadequate information

ElementDescription: Gambling Disorder (need 4 threshold symptoms)
Notes: 3= Present; 1= Absent; 0= Not assessed

ElementDescription: The gambling behavior is not better accounted for by a Manic Episode. Rate threshold if no history of mania or if gambling occurred when not manic.
Notes: 3= Present; 1= Absent; 0= Not assessed

ElementDescription: Were the symptoms present for current (last year) or in the past only?
Notes: 1= Current (last year); 2= Past only (before last year)

ElementDescription: Gambling Disorder - criteria A and B coded threshold for the period of the last 12 months
Notes: 3= Present; 1= Absent; 0= Not assessed

ElementDescription: Age at onset of Gambling Disorder
Notes: 99= Unknown

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
Indicate types of gambling activity in the past year  that may have been problematic: Slot Machiens or Video Poker
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: Indicate types of gambling activity in the past year  that may have been problematic: Other
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: CRITERIA A AND B CODED 3 FOR THE PERIOD OF THE LAST 12 MONTHS
Notes: 1= Absent or False; 3= Present or True

ElementDescription: Indicate severity of Gambling Disorder for past 12 months: (circle the appropriate number)
Notes: 1= Mild, 4-5 criteria met; 2= Moderate, 6-7 criteria met; 3= Severe, 8-9 cirteria met

ElementDescription: Specify if: (circle the appropriate number)
Notes: 1= Episodic, meeting diagnostic criteria at more than one time point, with symptoms subsiding between periods of gambling disorder for at least several months; 2= Persistent, experiencing continuous symptoms, to meet diagnostic criteria for multiple years

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
In the past year, since (1 YEAR AGO), have you regularly gambled or regularly bought lottery tickets?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: Indicate types of gambling activity in the past year  that may have been problematic: Card Playing
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: Indicate types of gambling activity in the past year  that may have been problematic: Lottery
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: Indicate types of gambling activity in the past year  that may have been problematic: Horse Racing
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: Indicate types of gambling activity in the past year  that may have been problematic: Sports Betting
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: Indicate types of gambling activity in the past year  that may have been problematic: Casino Games (Blackjack, Roulette, Craps)
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes
